weather_report:
Current conditions in Evanston, Illinois, present a stark winter chill, with the temperature hovering in the low 20s and a brisk, northwesterly wind creating a biting wind chill, making the air feel closer to the single digits. The beach scene, though inviting in its stark beauty, bears witness to a mostly cloudy sky, contributing to a grey and somber ambiance that speaks of deep winter. As night approaches, temperatures are expected to drop to around 13 degrees, with a frostiness settling in, lending everything a crisp and brittle quality.

Looking ahead to Sunday, while the day may begin under a blanket of clouds, a slight warming trend will bring temperatures to near the mid-20s, albeit with continued wind chill effects. The waves on Lake Michigan are manageable but will be choppy, reflective of the blustery conditions. No precipitation is forecasted, keeping the pathway clear for outdoor pursuits, though it may lack the warmth and cheer of more temperate days. Dress warmly in layered clothing, with hats and gloves being essential to ward off the cold as you venture outside. Given the seasonal context, these conditions are entirely typical for winter in this region, so it's an ideal time to embrace indoor activities or brisk walks along the shore, where the frost-kissed scenery can be appreciated from a comfortable distance.
